notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 0 for SLE 15 SP2)
notes.title: Title of the patch

notes.text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 5.3.18-22 fixes several issues.

The following security issues were fixed:

- CVE-2020-36322: Fixed an issue inside the FUSE filesystem implementation where fuse_do_getattr() calls make_bad_inode() in inappropriate situations, could have caused a system crash. NOTE: the original fix for this vulnerability was incomplete, and its incompleteness is tracked as CVE-2021-28950 (bsc#1184952).
- CVE-2021-29154: Fixed BPF JIT compilers that allowed to execute arbitrary code within the kernel context (bsc#1184710)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: An issue was discovered in the FUSE filesystem implementation in the Linux kernel before 5.10.6, aka CID-5d069dbe8aaf. fuse_do_getattr() calls make_bad_inode() in inappropriate situations, causing a system crash. NOTE: the original fix for this vulnerability was incomplete, and its incompleteness is tracked as CVE-2021-28950.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: BPF JIT compilers in the Linux kernel through 5.11.12 have incorrect computation of branch displacements, allowing them to execute arbitrary code within the kernel context. This affects arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp.c and arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp32.c.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
